description: autonomous mode on background, no gui loading

I have a GPU which I wish to use for folding instead of using most of the CPU cores which I use for other tasks since the GPU is much more efficient. Every month or so, FAH looses track of the GPU and regardless of what driver is used for the GPU, the only fix is a reinstall of FAH. Very frustrating. The machine is set to turn on and off automatically and so, if not checked on, may have been running without folding for a long time wasting power.
summary: Keeps loosing track of GPU, only fix is a reinstall

description: Does its thing. But is not intuitive and a bit confusing, however this is from a former Windows user.
frustrating with fahcontrol
summary: fahcontrol fails to work in Ubuntu 19.10

description: Doesn't install fahcontrol which is needed to load and unload. By default it will run in the background at all times. I'll reinstall when it's fixed.
summary: Does it's thing, on its own

description:
Just make sure you're following directions. 

Note for dev - 

I would add this to the directions: 

sudo snap start folding-at-home-fcole90.client
cannot turn it on. While uninstalling redirects to ubuntu software with only option to install again

FAHClient works, FAHViewer works, but FAHControl is based on Python 2, which Ubuntu 20.04 doesn't support. As a temporary fix, there's an unofficial experimental Python 3 build of FAHControl - see https://github.com/FoldingAtHome/fah-control/pull/56
summary: A good way to help in the fight against COVID-19

description: Please update to the newest Version 7.6.9 which gives the option to prioritize COVID-19 projects

run as sudo: `sudo folding-at-home-fcole90 `
Then open Fahcontrol (without sudo).
summary: Needs to be run as sudo

description: Went from 18.04 to 19.10 to 20.04. Somewhere along that path, the FAHControl disappeared but it was still folding and controllable via the web interface. Reinstalling solved the problem.

Projeto já evoluiu bastante, mas essa versão é muito antiga e cheia de bugs, a empresa(canonical) poderia fazer um esforço para ajudar deixar a nova versão compatível com o sistema, pois para instalar o FAHControl da um pouco de trabalho. Lembrado que esse projeto vem trabalhando para encontrar a cura de várias doenças, além de ele tá focado nesse momento no combate ao COVID-19.
Not sure why anyone would rate this low.
Great app for helping scientists.
summary: Simple to install and easy to use mostly

description: Works cool but lacks some fixes available on newest version of fah control

Works as it should most of the time, about 15% more efficient than running on windows client. however, after a system reboot i usually need to remove and reinstall the app for my GPU to be recognised. 
Not a problem for me as i usualy leave the PC foilding 99% of the time. but for those that need to frequently turn the computer on and off it probably isnt worth the effort.
summary: works but sometimes fails after reboot

description:
Needs to be updated to the latest version on the website.
Installing manually is almost imposible and forget about GPU support.

Will happily donate a Ryzen 3800x and a Radeon VII when your software works.

Currently the webcontrol is garbage - no way to configure my GPU, No control what so ever. Please give me a proper program (like on windows and mac) rather than this junk

I had to uninstall the Folding@Home application on account that it stopped folding a few days ago. Also, when I tried to delete a bad Working Unit, it wouldn't let me. It also wouldn't allow to chnage the number of CPU cores for the Working Unit itself.

The description says that the version is 7.6, but upon finishing the installation, the version is 7.5.

Using Ubuntu 20.04.1 LTS

Ubuntu's version is a step or two behind the F@H website's, and installing the one from the website is non-trivial since Canonical broke backwards compatability with python2. 

GPU folding is nonfunctional. Ubunt's MESA-opencl package does not work. ROCm might, if you have an AMD card, but that is also difficult to get working on Ubuntu. If you want to fold on a GPU then do not waste your time installing this.
It would be nice to have idle mode background auto run function enabled. Right now idle mode doesn't work
Runs something in the background, but there's nothing to say that it's actually doing what it's supposed to. Not impressed. Removed.
summary: I press launch. It does nothing

description: Works just fine, all controls and settings are there.
Does what its suppost to.
Die Idee ist gut, verlangsamt aber den Rechner ungemein.

Kein Zugriff auf das control panel.
Prozess wird im Monitor nicht angezeigt.
Prozess wird bei den installierten Programmen nicht angezeit.
Verlangsamt den Rechner massiv.
Terminal hilf.
Funktioniert gut, meistens ;-) keine Probleme
Gute Möglichkeit, um die ungenutzte Zeit des Rechners für etwas gutes zu verwenden!

2 instances fonctionnent en même temps.
une pour vous
et une autre sûrement pour le développeur qui n'est pas contrôlable.
